eventName: A Thousand Years in a Sigh
storyName: A Thousand Years in a Sigh
storyInfo: Nian has some history with the city of Shangshu, and revisiting it has stirred some memories. She opts to reminisce for a spell, in her own way.

attributes.content: Shangshu, Great Cold, Year 507, light snow.
Yo, there you are.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: We have an agreement.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: One hundred whole days.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: The snow on the way held one up by some nights. I would be here even earlier otherwise.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Must have what I wanted if you're back so soon, then?
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: It has been brought. The spiciest pepper in all of Shangshu.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Looks like you did a pretty good job. Can't have been easy finding something this fresh through months of snowstorms.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: You've crouched hidden, sir, for years on years, and yet you know of blizzards in the human realm?
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Oh? Sounds like you're getting at something.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: Shangshu's mountains wind long and hard; there's always someplace to shelter from the winds.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: One traveled all over the Three Mounts and Eighteen Peaks, visiting every household and inn, sampling one by one...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: You know what, save the story. Kitchen's over that way, ingredients and utensils are all there. Get your cook on.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Please have a taste, sir.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Oh? What, just simple shuizhu?
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: Even so, not many in Shangshu would afford this dish these days.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Neat. I'll give it a try.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: What do you... think, sir?
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Heh. It's a fundamental truth that the slices of meat in shuizhu all have to be equally thick, but you've even cut them all to identical form—I have to compliment the knifework. But...
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: Tsk. It's not got much flavor.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: If this is the spiciest pepper you could find in all of Shangshu, then I'm sorry to say the sword can't go to you.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: Sir—!
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: One doesn't seek your sword for her own selfish desires, but in petition for the common folk! I beg you—
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: It doesn't matter to me why you want the sword. If the chili's not good, then you're not having it.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: I've had enough for today. Go on home.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: But a moment, please.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: The swordsman draws the dagger holstered on her side, and cuts open her wrist with not a pause of hesitation. Fresh, her carmine blood drips into the stew.
Why not see, sir... if the taste satisfies you now?
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: That's fun.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: Take it.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: Shangshu's spiciest pepper, in exchange for Shangshu's finest blade. The fairest trade.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: My thanks, sir!
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Don't thank me, we made an agreement. That's business.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: Something else on your mind?
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: You give me this sword so reassured, and don't even ask what I would use it for?
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Doesn't matter to me if you cut firewood, heads or a mean deal at the pawn shop, so long as after a hundred days, you hand it back to me.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: If I were to break it, carelessly...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: If anything in this world could break that sword, I'd like to see it.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: If...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: If you've got regrets, you can just give it back to me now.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: No... I swear on my soul. In a hundred days, I will return it as it came to me.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Alright, you can get out of my sight now. Down the mountain you go.
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: My thanks, sir. One has her greatest gratitude.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Interesting, seriously interesting...
attributes.name: Swordsmith

attributes.content: 'A fine sword... and fine technique.
attributes.name: 'Hat of the Ink'

attributes.content: Wrngh... huff... huff...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Marvelous, marvelous... that was truly beyond belief.
What don't you believe? That a blind woman could outspeed your 'Hat of the Ink's' blade, or that someone out there existed who could forge a sword to fell yours?
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Ke Luxi of the Twilight... you've lost...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Uh-huh. Have I, now?
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: You said that to anyone who could produce a sword stronger than yours, you would tell how you make the 'Divine Meteonite.' Now, it's time you made good on your pledge.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Ha, I did say so... but I'm wondering. With a weapon that exceptional, do you even still need my formula?
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: The need is not mine, but the people of Shangshu's.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: A Catastrophe passed through, and many are displaced. Shangshu is troubled. If they had the 'Divine Meteonite,' safe shelter from the elements could be built that much faster.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Sir K'o, our mutual contention is but a thing of the past. No further argument, nor hate, supersedes the common folk. A victor in this duel of swords is clear. In mind and heart, you ought to—
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Hahahaha... trust a hero to worry over the nation and her people. Sorry to tell you...
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: You were too naive. There was never such a thing as 'Divine Meteonite'.
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: What did you say?!
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Let me ask you a question now, about that sword. Did it come from Zuanjiang Peak? From a red-horned and red-eyed swordsmith?
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: How do you know—
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Heh. I figured you'd only find one swordsmith in all of Yan with a fighting chance against me.
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: Ke Luxi, you did all this just to...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Correct. I just couldn't understand! My swordsmithing technique is apex, it's peak! So how does it still not beat hers?!
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: I've been tossing and turning this past decade, dying just to get my hands on a sword of her own making. I'll research it, engineer it, figure out just what kind of art went into making it!
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: I should really thank you for coming all this way, just to drop her sword off with us.
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: Now, be nice and give up the goods, and I'll let you go.
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: So be it...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: This complete swindle isn't worth arguing with you over. If there never was any 'Divine Meteonite,' then I don't want to bother with you for even a second longer.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: And yet this sword's time with me is borrowed. I must return it as agreed. I can't let you take it.
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: You don't know what's good for you... Forth!
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: What's a single fine swordswoman's limit? How many does it take? Ready!
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: (Gasp)
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Still not willing to listen to me? Then you asked for it.
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: Fire—
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: Tsk. That's just embarrassing, Ke Luxi. If you love my swords so much, you could always say it to my face. Why waste all your effort, and this li'l lady's?
Just concede, and I'll give you all you could want. I can even sign the hilts for you.
Nian Huihan! What are you doing here?!
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: I finally caught a break for ten years. Now I have to find just who cares about me so much, and it turns out it's you after all.
attributes.name: Nian Huihan

attributes.content: Sir...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: And you, you're honest to a fault. It's one sword, that's all. If they wanted it, you could've just given it to them. Why get yourself hurt in the process?
attributes.name: Nian Huihan

attributes.content: I told you, I swore on my soul...
attributes.name: Yi

attributes.content: Hah. I'll admit, that's just like you.
attributes.name: Nian Huihan

attributes.content: But first. Now that I'm here, no sword or its warrior should be trying any more funny business.
attributes.name: Nian Huihan

attributes.content: S... Seize them!
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: Heavenly forge—
attributes.name: Nian Huihan

attributes.content: So that's it? Let's pull out any last tricks we've got on the count of three.
attributes.name: Nian Huihan

attributes.content: ...I truly do hate your lofty guts. Since the day I lost to you ten years ago, I've vowed in secret to make you pay the price for your arrogance.
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: What can you do? You put up some tepid competition for our line of work. I couldn't even muster much of my own drive.
attributes.name: Nian Huihan

attributes.content: Heheh... Nian Huihan, you're too conceited. You thought no one under Heaven could match you in the art of the forge, and so you fossilized.
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: This is the day you regret laying about for the last ten years! I'll show you the leaps and bounds my metallurgy has taken!
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: Come forth, Archbeast Mechanica!
attributes.name: Ke Luxi

attributes.content: (Screeching) Diiii—didiiii—
attributes.name: Archbeast Mechanica

attributes.content: (Furious roaring) Diiiii—
attributes.name: Archbeast Mechanica

attributes.content: C—Cut!!!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: What? C'mon, we're just about to hit the climax.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Why does every single one of your movies have to end with a giant kaiju?!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Huh? 'Cause it's cooler that way, duh.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: But isn't this meant to be Yanese wuxia?!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Don't let genres box in your thinking. Kung fu, suspense, sci-fi... the more marketing elements, the better, yeah?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: You should hire Whisperain as a literary consultant before you ever touch another screenplay...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: And you're going to drag Closure in to play the villain? Since when does she have the time to humor your nonsense?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: And! Also! I've wanted to roast you for this since the beginning! You always say I'm the lead, so why do you keep stealing the spotlight at all the key moments?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Aww, don't be so petty. The big sacrifice scene in the climax is all yours.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I die in this?!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: The character, the character dies.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: What are you calling this one? 'Call of the Deadly Swordswoman' or 'Forged in Berserk?'
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: 'Ruthless Sword vs. the Queen of the Machines.'
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I'm begging you now, don't slap Rhodes Island's name on this movie when you distribute it or all our partner firms are going to question our taste.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Sure, everyone's a critic these days, but do you know how much cash Wrankwood rakes in each year on these kinds of movies?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Convinced now?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I've given up...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I shouldn't be wasting my free time listening to you read these stories.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I have training this afternoon. I'm off.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Remember to come back to hear the ending.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Like hell I will!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Wait a moment, I have one more question...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: What parts of this story were true?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Huh? Where's that coming from?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: The story sounds stupid to the max overall, but I also feel like—some details didn't feel completely made-up...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Oh? So what do you think? Which parts sound real to you?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Was there really a blind swordswoman?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Caught your interest?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Are you going to tell me or not?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: No matter what 'the truth' is, it can only be 'stories' once you're hearing it. How can asking if 'stories' are true not be self-contradictory?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Forget it, I'm sure you made it all up at random. Why should I care...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Bye.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Wait, wait, I was gonna let you stay on as director!
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Count me out until you come up with a screenplay even slightly more normal!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: *Sigh* Maybe I'm too avant garde for modern audiences to understand... I guess they'll catch up, sooner or later.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: But I've got all this stuff to prep in advance, and if li'l Lava's not with me, I'm not gonna get it done on my own.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I heard people turned dour as they became older. Not that I believed it until now.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Did the trip to Shangshu make you miss someone?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: What d'you think? You'd say it's a touching story too, wouldn't you?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I have no interest in wasting time criticizing your turgid film scripts... Did you grind my entire evening to a halt just to make me read this?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Fine, I've read it all. Now stop bothering me, and get out.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: What else do you want?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I want to invite you to do some storyboarding and concept art.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Dream on!
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I swear, I am going to incinerate every last one of your garbage films while you sleep.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: You're all grown up now. Why do you still act out like such a kid?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: How many years has it been?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: What was that?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Don't be stupid.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Why does this sound like you've seen straight through my story?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Being too easily understood's kind of its own blow to an author, you know.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Too bad we've known each other for so long, 'big sis.'
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I did genuinely want to look through the Sui Regulator's criminal records, just to see what kind of mortifying history you left behind.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: You and li'l Lava are two peas in a pod with your tempers. Always gotta pretend like you don't care, even when you're so obviously curious.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Let me be clear. I haven't the slightest interest in your lousy screenplay, but I do want to know what you're dwelling on so miserably that you wrote this entire scenario as a roundabout homage.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Sure. Put on some tea, and we can chat nice and easy.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: You have to tell it as it was... No garnishes allowed.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Haha... really, I couldn't tell you which year or month it was. I only remember nomadic cities didn't exist yet.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: And I remember, it was snowing that day.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Even without the year, I know I finally had enough of that tomb, and thought I'd head up to the surface to kill my boredom.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: But it was ordinary sights everywhere I looked. Came out, and it was all the same as when I went in.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: And I thought to myself, y'know, in the end, this is all people are. You make a crowd of a million fight for a moment of glory in the battlesands, but their lives only amount to a couple decades in the end. What are they ever gonna contribute?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I was just passing the time, wandering wherever. But the Sui Regulator sure didn't like me idle, so they dumped an errand on me, had me head to Shangshu just after a Catastrophe hit, help the locals rebuild the city.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: The Sui Regulator has a lot of confidence sending you on these jobs.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: It's pretty much where my role lands, right? I'm specialized for it.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: So you worked obediently?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: You bet I didn't.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: How brazen of you.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: *Sigh* I can't say I totally slacked, but the terrain in Shangshu was vicious stuff at the time. Even if I took it seriously, drumming up a three-story building would be a heck of a lot of effort.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: But what the Sui Regulator specified was to 'build a city that can withstand a small Catastrophe.' They just wanted to weigh me down on purpose, right?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: So, I went as I felt, helped with some small stuff sometimes, gave a demo or two.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Shangshu's food really hit the spot for me, so I didn't mind staying for a while.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Until one day...
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Some kid found out where I lived, and begged me to make a sword.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I guess I wasn't too low-key living in Shangshu. Made sense I left a legend or two behind. But I didn't expect... Oripathy to take both his eyes.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Honestly, you've been here for days. What exactly are you thinking?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Sir, I only wish for you to grant me a sword. One is ready to pay any price in exchange.
attributes.name: Young Swordsman

attributes.content: Sounds fine, but what price can you afford? Besides, what do you want a sword for?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: To save. To avenge.
attributes.name: Young Swordsman

attributes.content: Gah... that's a headache.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: No matter how I asked, he just answered the same four words, 'to save, to avenge'—but I didn't even care, to be honest.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I got seriously sick of him and just forged him a random sword. And he'd never be able to afford it, in any scenario, so I could only lend it to him. He'd have to give it back in a hundred days.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: After about three months, I practically forgot about it when one day, out of nowhere, an old guy came calling.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I knew him. He was the owner of an inn at the edge of the city.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: He gave me a bundle, with a broken sword wrapped inside.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: What's this?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: A child gave me some money, and asked me to deliver this to the swordsmith living on Zuanjiang Peak.
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: *Sigh*... We've had spring chills for the last few days, and snow. It's a treacherous road up here, I tell you...
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: He told you to give to me? Why didn't he come himself?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Ohh... he broke it, so he's too shy to see me in person?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I suppose he's... passed on by now...
attributes.name: Old Man

attributes.content: Why—did he die?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I've got no idea.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: What? Did that old man not tell you?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: He told me he did what the youngster said, went to a specific place at a specific time to pick up the sword. He got there, and he saw nothing but burnt-out ruins.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Who knows how long it was burning, but nothing in there was recognizable anymore. Just that broken sword lying in the middle, nothing else.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I'm beginning to feel as if you're spinning a tale again.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Aw, that's just uncalled for. Can't you even have the most basic trust in your sister here?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: What happened next?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Nothing to speak of. I didn't ask much more, and frankly, I wasn't the least bit interested.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I cast that broken sword back into a new billet, and had the old guy take it down for the city craftsmen to use.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: If that material could teach them a thing or two, I was sure it'd improve their tech, so I considered myself even with the Sui Regulator.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: You get bored staying too long in one place, so after that, I left Shangshu.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: And there I thought to myself, I gave them some pointers, helped them improve their art; they ought to realize Shangshu's not suitable for long-term habitation, and go find another home. Acceptable ending, by and large.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Until fifty years later, I went back to Shangshu again.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: And in those towering mountains, I found a city.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: The Three Mounts and Eighteen Peaks of Shangshu. Rugged place to put passes through, and the plank walkways people set up were just one death road after another; the peaks were steep, yet they'd have a tower built at the crowning summits.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I obviously could've taken the credit, thought how if I didn't give them any tips, it'd be anyone's guess, the years they'd polish their tech to reach that level of understanding.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: But the sight of those vast walls in the sunlight, I was honestly just stunned. Not a thought like that ever came to me.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I never expected to hear you say anything like that.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Maybe that was the moment my thinking changed.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: People. They really are neat after all.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Is that the end?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I guess so.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: If you have to be technical, there's still a tiny little epilogue...
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Anybody home?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Come in, come right in! Sit anywhere you like!
attributes.name: Innkeeper

attributes.content: 'Xingcheng Inn'... Was that always this place's name?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: You may not know, but they say that fifty years ago, Shangshu went through a Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Innkeeper

attributes.content: My grandpa brought in divine metal from a god, and that was the metal our craftsmen built the modern Shangshu with.
attributes.name: Innkeeper

attributes.content: My grandpa wanted to commemorate it, so he changed the name of the shop to 'Xingcheng', just like our new city rising.
attributes.name: Innkeeper

attributes.content: That's neat. Then did your grandpa ever tell you the prequel to that story?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Like, about a blind swordsman, maybe a broken blade?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: You're a funny one, ma'am. The god's metal's just a legend, no more. Where's a swordsman breaking anything come from?
attributes.name: Innkeeper

attributes.content: If you want to hear about fifty years ago, you'll have to find the storyteller in the teahouse. It'll cost you a pretty penny to listen to his nonsense, too.
attributes.name: Innkeeper

attributes.content: Yeah, you're right. It was fifty years ago.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Whatever, I'm just rambling... hey, boss, I'll have some shuizhu, extra spicy!
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Coming up! Just one moment.
attributes.name: Innkeeper

attributes.content: Seriously...
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: It was just a sword...
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: By the sound of it, you regret it?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I kind of do.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Do you regret not giving that boy a better sword, or that you didn't go see for yourself just what ended him?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: I regret not coming out a few years earlier.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: All those years buried in that pitch-black tomb. Really was a waste of time.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: And who knows how much time we have left, still.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: No matter what... you always come back to this topic.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: Don't just shrug it off like that. Isn't this the biggest household argument our whole family's got?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: I'm tired. I'm going to bed. Hurry up and leave.
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: And since when did you start being able to sleep again?
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Admit it, li'l sis. We're all still in a dream. It's so crammed with interesting stuff, it's got us forgetting just how fragile the dream really is.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: But we'll have to wake up at some point.
attributes.name: Nian

attributes.content: Suit yourself. How do you plan to take a dream out with you?
attributes.name: Dusk

attributes.content: First, find a way to make it carry on a little longer. If we're going to wake up no matter what, then I'd like to ready up a giant firecracker, and blow this dream apart with my own hands.
attributes.name: Nian
